page.title: 17THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY
page.content: Approximatly 12% of Castle School pupils are of the Muslim faith and, therefore,should have thier community represented in the Domesday Project. This Muslim Community is composed of two sets,Tabliq Muslims and Sunnie Muslims.Both sets have their own place of worship in Lancaster and each is close to were they live.The Sunnies use the Mosque in Blade Street and the Tabliqs use the one at the bottom of Albion street.Both Mosques are made from houses.In Castle School itself there are 16 Sunnie and 15 Tabliq children.The Muslim Community came to Britain from India because they thought that they would have a better standard of living and better prospects for them and their children than if they stayed at home.Some came on marriage grounds. Some came to join their families who had already come to Britain.
